page.title: 05AN OLD RESIDENT'S VIEW
page.content: The eldest man in Boothby Pagnell aged 84,said that originally the village was a farming village.He had lived in the village since 1938 and the main source of power was the water from the River Glen.The main source of drinking water was an underground stream which was pumped by 1 man who lived in the club house. The farms around the village could not use horses for ploughing because they were not strong enough so they used bulls instead.The local blacksmith used to make shoes for the bulls rather similar to a horse's shoe in his forge in the village. The carpenter in the village,up till recently repaired things and also made coffins in his workshop also in the village.
